cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi north of the western tip of Cuba and 370 mi SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north this morning, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s Big Bend; after landfall Wednesday it is forecast to sweep northeast across southeast Georgia and the eastern Carolinas and move offshore of North Carolina late Thursday night/early Friday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound, GA northward to South Santee River, SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA (Tropical Storm Warning) and Middle of Longboat Key, FL to Indian Pass, FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Big Bend, then the southeast U.S. coastline including eastern Georgia and the eastern Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Wednesday night through Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible along the lower Cape Fear region, including the Port of Wilmington, especially around high tide Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts could produce flash flooding around Wilmington Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands and dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Wednesday
